workflow.name: Analyze customer feedback with Azure GPT-4, Jira tasks & Outlook reports from Monday.com
workflow.description:
## Description
Automate customer feedback analysis and action planning by integrating Monday.com, Azure OpenAI, Jira, Google Sheets, and Outlook. This workflow classifies customer feedback with AI, calculates business impact, creates Jira tasks for high-priority issues, and sends weekly performance summaries ‚Äî turning raw feedback into actionable insights. üí¨üìàü§ñ

## What This Template Does
- Step 1: Triggers automatically every Monday at 9:00 AM to fetch new customer feedback from Monday.com. ‚è∞
- Step 2: Normalizes and structures data into consistent fields (title, account, ARR, NPS, etc.). üß©
- Step 3: Uses Azure OpenAI GPT-4 to classify sentiment and identify feedback themes (e.g., ‚ÄúUI Design,‚Äù ‚ÄúApp Crash‚Äù). üß†
- Step 4: Calculates a business impact score based on ARR, NPS delta, and sentiment weightings. ‚öôÔ∏è
- Step 5: Creates Jira tasks for high-impact feedback items for product or engineering follow-up. üé´
- Step 6: Logs all feedback and impact scores into Google Sheets for analytics dashboards. üìä
- Step 7: Generates a professional HTML report summarizing metrics, wins, and risks, then emails it via Outlook. üìß
- Step 8: Sends automated error-alert emails if any node fails during execution. üö®

## Key Benefits
‚úÖ Converts qualitative feedback into measurable business intelligence
 ‚úÖ Identifies critical customer issues automatically using AI
 ‚úÖ Reduces manual effort in triaging and prioritizing feedback
 ‚úÖ Creates real-time visibility for product and CX teams
 ‚úÖ Provides weekly executive summaries and performance insights

## Features
- Weekly scheduled trigger (every Monday 9 AM)
- Monday.com data fetching and field normalization
- Azure OpenAI GPT-4-based sentiment and theme detection
- Impact scoring combining ARR + NPS + sentiment weighting
- Jira issue creation with context-rich descriptions
- Google Sheets logging for dashboards and historical records
- Outlook HTML email reports for leadership visibility
- Automated Gmail error-notification system

## Requirements
- Monday.com API credentials with board access
- Azure OpenAI GPT-4 API credentials
- Jira Software Cloud API credentials
- Google Sheets OAuth2 credentials with edit permissions
- Microsoft Outlook OAuth2 credentials for email delivery
- Gmail OAuth2 credentials for error alerting

## Target Audience
- Product and CX teams analyzing customer sentiment
- SaaS businesses tracking post-implementation feedback
- Customer-success and support operations teams
- Product managers prioritizing improvements based on impact
- Leadership teams monitoring customer health and satisfaction

## Step-by-Step Setup Instructions
1Ô∏è‚É£ Connect Monday.com API and update your boardId and groupId.
 2Ô∏è‚É£ Configure Azure OpenAI GPT-4 credentials for the AI classifier.
 3Ô∏è‚É£ Set Jira project ID and issue type for ticket creation.
 4Ô∏è‚É£ Link Google Sheets and replace YOUR_SHEET_ID.
 5Ô∏è‚É£ Connect Outlook OAuth2 and add recipient email for reports.
 6Ô∏è‚É£ Configure Gmail OAuth2 for error alerts.
 7Ô∏è‚É£ Adjust the cron expression (0 9 * * 1) to fit your timezone.
 8Ô∏è‚É£ Test the workflow end-to-end with sample data.
 9Ô∏è‚É£ Enable automation for seamless weekly feedback intelligence. ‚úÖ

workflow.name: AI-Driven Feedback Classification and Reporting from Monday.com and Jira to Outlook

parameters.content:
## üìä Customer Feedback Intelligence Workflow

**Purpose:** Automatically process customer feedback from Monday.com, analyze with AI, create Jira tasks, and send weekly reports.

**Key Features:**
- Fetches feedback from Monday.com boards
- AI-powered sentiment analysis and theme classification
- Automatic Jira issue creation for product team
- Google Sheets logging for analytics
- Weekly HTML email reports via Outlook
- Error notification system

**Data Flow:**
1. Fetch feedback from Monday.com
2. Normalize and structure data
3. AI analyzes sentiment & categorizes themes
4. Calculate business impact scores
5. Create Jira tasks for high-priority items
6. Log to Google Sheets
7. Generate and send weekly summary report

**Schedule:** Runs every Monday at 9:00 AM

‚ö†Ô∏è **Setup Required:** Configure credentials for Monday.com, Azure OpenAI, Jira, Google Sheets, and Outlook before running.

## Step 1: Fetch Feedback Data

Retrieves all customer feedback items from Monday.com board.

**Setup:**
- Replace `boardId` with your Monday.com board ID
- Configure Monday.com API credentials
- Ensure `groupId` matches your board structure

## Step 2: Normalize Data

Extracts and standardizes feedback fields into consistent format.

**Fields Mapped:**
- Title (feedback text)
- Account Name
- ARR (Annual Recurring Revenue)
- NPS Before/After scores
- Feedback Type
- Contact Email
- Submission Date

## Step 3: AI Theme Classification

Uses Azure OpenAI to analyze feedback and extract:
- Theme category (e.g., "app-crash", "ui-design")
- Human-readable label
- Sentiment (positive/neutral/negative)

**Setup:**
- Configure Azure OpenAI credentials
- Model: GPT-4o
- Returns structured JSON output

## Step 4: Create Jira Issues

Automatically creates Jira tasks with:
- Theme as title
- Feedback text in description
- ARR impact and NPS data
- Sentiment analysis
- Impact score

**Setup:**
- Replace `project` ID with your Jira project
- Configure Jira credentials
- Customize issue type if needed

## Step 5: Log to Google Sheets

Appends processed feedback to Google Sheets for:
- Long-term analytics
- Dashboard integration
- Historical tracking

**Setup:**
- Replace `documentId` with your Sheet ID
- Configure Google Sheets OAuth2
- Ensure sheet has matching columns

## Error Handling

Catches workflow failures and sends email alerts.

**Alert includes:**
- Workflow name
- Execution ID
- Failed node name
- Error message
- Timestamp

**Setup:**
- Set environment variable `ERROR_ALERT_EMAIL`
- Configure Gmail OAuth2 credentials

parameters.subject: =n8n Workflow Error: {{ $workflow.name }}

parameters.content:
## Trigger: Weekly Schedule

Automatically runs every Monday at 9:00 AM.

**Cron Expression:** `0 9 * * 1`
- Minute: 0
- Hour: 9 (9 AM)
- Day of Month: * (any)
- Month: * (any)
- Day of Week: 1 (Monday)

Adjust the schedule in node settings if needed.

options.systemMessage:
=You are an intelligent product feedback classifier. 
Your job is to analyze each feedback text and extract structured insights.

Follow these strict rules:
- Output must be valid JSON only (no markdown, no explanations).
- Identify the underlying theme or category of the feedback.
- Create a short, human-readable label for that theme.
- Detect overall sentiment (positive, neutral, negative).
- Do not repeat the full feedback text in output.

parameters.content:
## Step 3b: Structure AI Output

Converts AI classification results into clean format:
- Extracts ARR and NPS values as numbers
- Combines theme data from AI
- Preserves original feedback text
- Prepares data for impact scoring

## Step 3c: Calculate Impact Score

Calculates business impact using weighted formula:
- 50% weight: ARR value (normalized)
- 30% weight: NPS stability
- 20% weight: Sentiment severity

Higher scores = higher priority for product team.

## Step 6: Weekly Email Report

Generates professional HTML email with:
- Executive summary
- Key metrics dashboard
- Critical issues (high ARR or NPS drops)
- Customer wins
- Complete feedback table

**Setup:**
- Configure Outlook OAuth2
- Replace recipient email address
- Runs automatically every Monday

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details: In n8n, when a workflow execution fails, it can start another workflow. This second workflow can be any arbitrary workflow on your n8n instance. Use the Error Trigger node as your Trigger in the Error workflow.
